title: Must watch: Nepal tourism documentary shows the reality on the ground today
text:
Must watch: Nepal tourism documentary shows the reality on the ground today Adv: 
Jul 13, 2015 Adv: 
The Nepal based Passion To Travel Community with the support of the Hawaii, Brussels, Seychelles and Bali based International Coalition of Tourism Partners (ICTP) released this inside report today. It was produced by dedicated leaders of the Nepal Travel and Tourism industry. A simple message and appeal: Nepal welcomes visitors! Listen to people running hotels, shops and attractions, and hear it from the visitors. 
"This video is a must watch for the world to understand today's reality in Nepal. It concentrates on the state of the travel and tourism industry, its infrastructure and expectations. I hope tour operators, travel agents, the UNWTO, PATA and WTTC together with the global media will watch and circulate this video to the world. The world should learn Nepal is again safe and ready for an inspiring vacation. This video is a brilliant example on how the work by some dedicated people in our industry could make a difference for millions in Nepal relying directly or indirectly on the income produced by the largest industry on the globe, our travel and tourism industry", says ICTP Chairman and eTN Publisher Juergen Thomas Steinmetz. 
"Taking a cultural or trekking trip to Nepal would be one of the most sustainable ways to empathize with its people. Nepal is determined to bounce back building the Nation better and stronger than ever. Friends of Nepal, you are encouraged to share this message to the world!" "The reality in Nepal is that tourism is safe and back!" 
These are the words Pankaj Pradhananga has to the world. As the new president and chairman of the Himalayan Chapter for the International Coalition of Tourism Partners (ICTP) Pankaj and his team spent one month of hard work to produce this video. 
Today Pankaj presented his new documentary to the Everest Toastmasters Club. 
He told eTN: "Tomorrow I am going to showcase it at NATTA ( Nepal Association of Tour and Travel agents). The documentary was produced under the umbrella of the "Passion To Travel Community'. 
The purpose is to communicate to the world about the reality on the ground today in Nepal. It's to encourage travel to Nepal in the aftermath of the devastating April Earthquake. 
The reality is: General life is back to normal and Tourism on the path of slow but steady recovery."
